thread.title: ATT profit beats Street raises full-year forecast
thread.title_full: ATT profit beats Street raises full-year forecast

title: ATT profit beats Street raises full-year forecast
text:
AT&T profit beats Street, raises full-year forecast 
St. Louis Post-Dispatch Friday 23rd October, 2015 
AT&T Inc, long the No. 2 U.S. wireless carrier and since July the world's biggest pay-TV operator, raised its full-year earnings forecast after reporting a better-than-expected quarterly profit as it added more wireless mobile subscribers.The company, reporting its first earnings since completing its $48 billion acquisition of satellite TV operator DirecTV in July, raised its adjusted earnings forecast to $2.68-$2.74 per share from $2.62-$2.68.Net income attributable to AT&T fell to $3.0 billion, or 50 cents per share, in the third quarter ended Sept. 30, from $3.13 billion, or 60 c...
